title: N Korea: US 'hell bent' on hostility and 'obsessed with sanctions'
text: North Korea says the US is "hell bent" on hostile acts and "obsessed with sanctions" – three days after Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un met in what Pyongyang called an "amazing event".

title: Kudlow says US-China trade talks to be held in person as soon as next week
text: Kudlow later backed away slightly from his timeline, saying that the face-to-face talks would begin "soon" and that an announcement would be forthcoming.

title: Why China Trade Talks May Hinge On North Korea's Kim Jong-Un
text: If China trade talks fail, the U.S. economy and Dow Jones would suffer.

title: Major averages close at record highs on dovish Fed hopes
text: U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday, with each of the major indexes closing at a record high, as expectations grew that the Federal Reserve would take a more dovish turn as a raft of data provided more evidence of a slowing economy.

title: Stocks set record closes as easy central bank policies spur stock-market gains
text: U.S. stocks finished on a strong note in a holiday-shortened session, pushing all three key equity benchmarks to new heights, amid increased expectations for more dovish policy.

title: Nasdaq trades above record close as all three benchmarks look to set new highs
text: The Nasdaq Composite Index  traded above its record closing price of 8,164, set on May 3, joining the S&P 500  and the Dow Jones Industrial Average , which were also on pace to set records, if early gains hold in a holiday-shortened trading session Wednesday. Stocks traded higher in the session on hopes of easy global monetary policy after news that current International Monetary Fund President Christine Lagarde was nominated to replace Mario Draghi as the head of the European Central Bank.

title: Trump's latest Fed moves are another step in trying to take control of interest rates
text: The president said he plans on sending the names of Christopher Waller and Judy Shelton to the Senate as Fed governor appointees.

title: S&P 500, Dow trade at records in early action as Wall Street digests a weak ADP jobs report
text: U.S. stocks rose modestly on Wednesday, in a holiday-shortened trading session, but enough for the S&P 500 to notch a intraday high.

title: Goldman Sachs: Two factors will keep the stock market stuck right here through the end of the year
text: Economic policy uncertainty and a decline in company earnings will keep the stock market from rallying any further, according to Goldman Sachs.

title: Trump threatened Hanoi on trade, but Vietnam just teamed up with the EU on a big new deal
text: Vietnam has emerged as a large beneficiary amid the U.S.-China trade deal.

title: Oil prices edge down, pressured by U.S. supply
text: Oil prices inched lower on Thursday after solid gains the day before, pressured by data showing a smaller-than-expected decline in U.S. crude stockpiles.

title: Stocks rally again on expected Fed rate cuts; euro on defensive
text: Asian stocks advanced on Thursday, tracking sharp gains on Wall Street as recent data from multiple sectors pointed to slowing economic growth in the United States, bolstering the prospect of rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

title: Bitcoin, ETH, XRP, And LTC Rally -- This Time It's Different
text: Trade wars and ultra low interest rates have helped major cryptocurrencies rise, as alternatives to the US dollar global ecosystem.

title: 30-Year Treasury Bonds Flash Economic Warning Signal
text: The bond market flashed yet another warning signal for investors on Wednesday that a downturn for the economy may be coming.

title: Major Indexes Close at Record Highs Wednesday
text: U.S. stocks were bullish on Wednesday after Christine Lagarde was nominated to become president of the European Central Bank.

title: Dow Jones, S&P Set New Records; Nasdaq At New Closing High
text: Key market indexes staged an early celebration Wednesday with new highs ahead of the July 4 holiday. The Dow Jones index and S&P 500 hit records.

title: US Indexes Close at New Highs on Wednesday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 26,966.00 on Wednesday with a gain of 179.32 points or 0.67%.

title: U.S. reviewing requests to export to Huawei with highest 'scrutiny': Commerce Department
text: The U.S. government said on Wednesday it is reviewing license requests from U.S. companies to export products to China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd "under the highest national security scrutiny," since the company is still blacklisted.

title: Dow Jones Today: Almost Some Half-Day Fireworks
text: A disappointing ADP private payroll survey was not enough to sour sentiment on most of the Dow Jones today. Here are the big moves to know.

title: Wall St. closes shortened session at record highs

title: 20 Best And Worst S&P 500 Stocks Through The First Half Of 2019
text: After a disappointing end to 2018, the S&P 500 has delivered impressive returns in the first half of 2018, gaining 17.3% year to date.

title: Oil prices steady as U.S. crude stockpiles drop less than expected
text: Oil prices were steady on Wednesday ahead of a U.S. holiday, after a steep fall the previous session when worries about a slowing global economy outweighed a decision by OPEC and allies to extend crude output cuts.

title: Jobs report could show a slowing trend and be the lever the Fed needs to cut rates
text: Ten years into the recovery, the economy's ability to create new jobs may be slowing.

title: EIA reports a slightly larger-than-expected weekly climb in U.S. natural-gas supplies
text: The U.S. Energy Information Administration reported Wednesday that domestic supplies of natural gas rose by 89 billion cubic feet for the week ended June 28.

title: US May Trade Deficit Widens to 2019 High Despite Tariffs
text: The U.S. trade deficit in goods grew to a total of $55.5 billion in May, according to Wednesday’s report from the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA).

text: Far East Consortium is differentiated from its peers due to its geographical diversification and a high proportion of recurring income.

text: Automakers’ U.S. sales in June were down compared to sales in the same month a year ago, but it appears that the industry did just about manage to meet expectations.

title: Dollar slides after Trump says the US should match 'currency manipulation game' of Europe and China
text: The greenback fell suddenly Wednesday after Trump said in a tweet that the U.S. should match China and Europe's "currency manipulation.

title: ADP Sets Soft Trend for Friday’s Payroll Report From the Labor Department
text: Each month’s ADP employment report gets to act as a preview and bias-setting event for the U.S. Department of Labor’s report on payrolls and national unemployment.

title: Wednesday's Market Minute: The Arms Race in Markets
text: Conflicting signals in markets right now are less perplexing if you picture two opposing camps piling into bets on the outcome of an expected reversal in Fed policy; one that views endless accommodation as endlessly bullish, the other as catastrophic.

title: Stock Market Rally Extends Gains, As S&P 500 Hits Record High
text: The major stock market indexes were modestly higher early Wednesday. Nike tried to regain a buy point, while Tesla surged on strong deliveries.

title: Global stock markets, bonds rally in expectation of rate cuts
text: Record low bond yields in Europe and the expectation of further interest rate cuts by central banks worldwide helped push global stock market indices higher Wednesday as the benchmark U.S. S&P 500 hit another record high.

text: If Friday's June jobs report looks as solid as Wall Street expects, then a super-sized Fed rate cut later this month seems unlikely.

text: The market is rising because there is no other place to put investment capital.

title: Flags Waving As Fourth Approaches With Stocks At Record Highs, But Yields Lag
text: A lot of market participants are struggling to understand what looks like an odd relationship now between rallying stocks and falling Treasury yields. Several explanations come to mind, as it appears bonds might be flashing a warning sign.

title: ADP Employment Data For June Comes In Worse Than Expected
text: ADP National Employment reports data for June was worse than expected with small business struggling to compete in a tight labor market.

title: American Companies Post Most Layoffs Since the Financial Crisis
text: The U.S. job market has been a growth engine of the U.S. economy since the Great Recession.

title: U.S. trade deficit surges to five-month high as imports soar
text: The U.S. trade deficit jumped to a five-month high in May as imports of goods increased, likely as businesses restocked ahead of an increase in tariffs on Chinese merchandise, eclipsing a broad rise in exports.

title: Why the Dow can keep rally going, even with weakest earnings outlook since 2006
text: Stocks surged in the first half of 2019, and the Dow ended June with its best monthly gain since 1938. The earnings outlook for the July quarter is weak, but market history suggests that the rally in the S&P 500 and Dow can continue.

title: Job creation has another rough month in June as private payrolls rise by just 102,000
text: The growth in private jobs missed even modest Wall Street expectations of 135,000 and signal a possibly weak nonfarm payrolls report Friday.

title: Carter Worth Sees The Bitcoin Pullback As A Buying Opportunity
text: Carter Worth said on Tuesday's "Fast Money" the recent 30% pullback in bitcoin is an opportunity to get long "if you're not long already.

title: What World Slump? $55 Billion To Emerging Markets
text: Over $18 billion a month will flow into countries like China this summer, BNP Paribas thinks.

title: Futures eke out gains as bond yields tumble on growth fears
text: U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Wednesday, as benchmark bond yields tumbled on fears of a global recession and expectations of interest rate cuts by central banks.

title: Mortgage Loan Rates Post Mixed Moves, New Applications Flat
text: The Mortgage Bankers Association (MBA) released its weekly report on mortgage applications Wednesday morning, noting a decrease of just 0.1% in the group’s seasonally adjusted composite index for the week ending June 28.

title: Need to Know: Investors have been buying almost everything, but look out, warns fund manager
text: We’ve headed down to Australia for our call of the day, where James Whelan, investment manager at VFS Group Global Macro Fund warns that ‘buy everything’ strategy that’s been working so well may be getting ready to burn some investors.
